views.markdown:
Compatible with iOS 11, 12 and 13. Compatible with all devices (including A12).

VideoSwipes is a tweak that adds swipe gestures to the stock iOS video player. It now also has support for YouTube and Facebook video players (also works on thumbnails). It allows to rewind/forward the video, change volume, change brightness and toggle play/pause. All of this with convenient gestures!

- Swipe left/right : rewind/forward the video of 15s (you can change the number of seconds in settings)
- Swipe up/down on the left of the screen : increase/decrease volume (configurable steps)
- Swipe up/down on the right of the screen : increase/decrease brightness (configurable steps)
- Swipe down on the middle of the screen : dismiss the player
- Long press anywhere : toggle play/pause

Don't forget to follow me on Twitter @AnthoPak to get live updates!

Feel free to contact me via Mail or via Twitter to submit bug reports or feature requests.

Note: be sure to have Cephei installed for settings to work.

- iOS 13 support - Add support for YouTube
- Add limited support for Facebook (only Rewind & Skip are supported)
- Add support for MediaPlayer (an other Apple player used in apps like TV)
- Add settings for brightness & volume steps cutomization
- Fix a respring loop some Uncover users reported when rejailbreaking with "Reload System Daemons" enabled
- Some minor bug fixes and improvements
- Add swipe up/down gestures to change volume and brightness
- Add long press to toggle play/pause
- Add icon
- Add settings page
- Change number of seconds to rewind/skip in settings
